Years later, when he reluctantly accepts a coaching job at his alma mater, he may get one last shot at redemption." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt8544498/","name":"The Way Back","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYjBjMTgyYzktN2U0Mi00YTJhLThkZDQtZmM1ZDlmNWMwZDQ3XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMDU5MDEyMA@@._V1_.jpg","description":"Jack Cunningham was a high school basketball phenom who walked away from the game, forfeiting his future. Years later, when he reluctantly accepts a coaching job at his alma mater, he may get one last shot at redemption.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt8544498/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"peter-laganis"},"dateCreated":"2020-04-15","inLanguage":"English","name":"What is this movie about?","reviewBody":"There is no doubt Ben Affleck did a GREAT job... but this is probably the only thing I will remember about the movie. The story completely lacks of originality, neglects the side characters and tends to stereotype and simplify the main character.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":7}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":40410,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.7},"contentRating":"R","genre":["Drama","Sport"],"datePublished":"2020-03-06","keywords":"alcoholism,basketball movie,basketball coach,cemetery,underdog","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"International Trailer","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi2639839001","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMWIzYmVkY2QtNTZlMy00MzE4LWE3NDktZWEzMGE2MjZmZmU3XkEyXkFqcGdeQWFybm8@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMWIzYmVkY2QtNTZlMy00MzE4LWE3NDktZWEzMGE2MjZmZmU3XkEyXkFqcGdeQWFybm8@._V1_.jpg","description":"Jack Cunningham (Ben Affleck) once had a life filled with promise. In high school, he was a basketball phenom with a full university scholarship, when suddenly, for reasons unknown, he walked away from the game, forfeiting his future. Now years later, Jack is spiralling down, triggered by an unspeakable loss, and drowning in the alcoholism that cost him his marriage and any hope for a better life. When he is asked to coach the basketball team at his alma mater, which has fallen far since his glory days, he reluctantly accepts, surprising no one more than himself. As the boys start to come together as a team and win, Jack may have finally found a reason to confront the demons that have derailed him. But will it be enough to fill the void, heal the deep wounds of his past, and set him on the road to redemption?"},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000255/","name":"Ben Affleck"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1371339/","name":"Al Madrigal"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1232470/","name":"Janina Gavankar"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0640334/","name":"Gavin O'Connor"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0002663/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0309252/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0706942/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm2145487/","name":"Brad Ingelsby"}],"duration":"PT1H48M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Australia
Australia
programme.desc:
Australia: Directed by Baz Luhrmann. With Shea Adams, Eddie Baroo, Ray Barrett, Tony Barry. Set in northern Australia before World War II, an English aristocrat who inherits a sprawling ranch reluctantly pacts with a stock-man in order to protect her new property from a takeover plot. As the pair drive 2,000 head of cattle over unforgiving landscape, they experience the bombing of Darwin, Australia, by Japanese forces firsthand." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0455824/","name":"Australia","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZjJhMTAyZWMtMjRlZC00NWU3LTg3ODQtYTkyZjRiN2NhY2Y5XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNTIzOTk5ODM@._V1_.jpg","description":"Set in northern Australia before World War II, an English aristocrat who inherits a sprawling ranch reluctantly pacts with a stock-man in order to protect her new property from a takeover plot. As the pair drive 2,000 head of cattle ","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0455824/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"Imdbidia"},"dateCreated":"2011-02-22","inLanguage":"English","name":"Old-style epic romantic movie","reviewBody":"An entertaining romantic drama by Buz Luhrmann, old-Hollywood style.

The movie is set in the Northern Territory of Australia in the years previous to the involvement of Japan in the WW II, and tells the story of Sarah Ashley -an English lady who goes to Australia to try to get her husband back to England and ends becoming the head of their Australian cattle farm-, Drover -an independent free-spirited cattle and horse drover that works for her- and Nullah -a half-caste Aboriginal child who lives in the farm and struggles to live in a world in which he's alien to both blacks and whites.

This is one of those movies that you can say it is done as the movies of the golden era of Hollywood used to be - flashy wonderfully well-looking movie stars, great scenery and great studio settings, detailed recreation of the era's fashion, decoration, atmosphere, etc., , and a simple epic plot with a great love story. Australia has all of this, but also a little bit of corn, a thin plot, weak characters and flaws that are even more noticeable in a super-production like this.

The script is uneven and Manichean (with angels and demons) and mixes several movie genres (romantic comedy, romantic drama, war movie, western movie, and Aboriginal movie) with different degrees of success. The characters are descriptive and without emotional depth, and that affects the acting. However, I loved the depiction of the magic and wisdom of Aboriginal Australians, which is really well presented, with its magic beliefs and philosophical and environmental approach to the world. I think that part is truly genuine and real and reaches the viewer. I also loved that Lady Ashley's character is the one of a true modern woman, as she is a strong-willed free woman, a boss, the boss of her man, a woman who always leads, never submissive or afraid of being alone if she doesn't get what she wants. That's a post-modern woman, so rare to see in cinema nowadays.

The acting is unconvincing on the part of the leading actors. Hugh Jackman's performance is just OK in his role, while Nicole Kidman disappoints in the comic part of the movie, as she seems not to relax when she does so, but she warms up to her usual self when the story becomes more dramatic; she looks beautiful in this movie, like a 50s movie star, although those inflated siliconed lips were a distraction... Jackman and Kidman make a great couple, but their chemistry on camera was nothing memorable and you see yourself seeing two actors playing a couple, not a real couple on screen.

Most supporting actors are good in their roles, especially the Aboriginal ones, who really shine in this film. David Gulpilil is simply terrific, completely believable and inspired in his role of the Aboriginal Elder King George. Brandon Walters, despite his youth, offers a memorable performance, and his face really lights up the screen. Also great is the actor who plays Drove's Aboriginal pal, who also offers a solid performance. They are the ones who really give soul to the movie.

Despite what you might expect, the cinematography is poor. I was expecting the rare beauty of the Northern Territory to be captured by the always stylish and colorful Luhrmann. However, the part of the movie that happens during the dry season is completely opaque and colorless, ugly to watch, while the scenes happening during the rainy season are again limited in colors.To my disenchantment, many of the most colorful and beautiful scenes are digitally created or enhanced, while others seem to have been shot in big studios. Just the Mission island seems to convey that luxurious real feeling of the NT vegetation. Some of the most beautiful bits of the real land, the aerial vistas, look like if they had been taken for a documentary for National Geographic. Where is the emotional connection of the story with the land? In other words, the viewer doesn't go beyond what the eyes see. So, one wonders, why the movie was called Australia and why it was sold as a movie that captured the spirit of this country. To be honest, I thought that most scenes in the movie could have been shot anywhere in the world not in Australia.

The movie is a little too long. Most of the first half an hour could have been removed , condensed or presented in another way to give the non-Aboriginal characters more emotional background and depth. For example, we barely know why Neil Fletcher wants so badly Sarah's farm, and why he's so wicked in general but he loves a lovable sweet good- hearted woman. He is just an archetypal bad-guy, period.

Despite its flaws, I enjoyed the movie, especially the second hour and a half, and that heaven of a man that is Hugh Jackman. God Bless him and his holy body.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":7}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":122133,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.6},"contentRating":"PG-13","genre":["Adventure","Comedy","Drama"],"datePublished":"2008-12-24","keywords":"prejudice,year 1942,year 1939,male objectification,australian aborigine","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Australia: Trailer #2","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi1784152089","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjI5NzMwOTUwMV5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwOTQ4MTczMzE@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjI5NzMwOTUwMV5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwOTQ4MTczMzE@._V1_.jpg","description":"Set in northern Australia before World War II, an English aristocrat who inherits a sprawling ranch reluctantly pacts with a stock-man in order to protect her new property from a takeover plot"},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000173/","name":"Nicole Kidman"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0413168/","name":"Hugh Jackman"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0011354/","name":"Shea Adams"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0525303/","name":"Baz Luhrmann"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0000756/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0062619/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0068628/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0064181/","name":"Stuart Beattie"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0525303/","name":"Baz Luhrmann"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0367838/","name":"Ronald Harwood"}],"duration":"PT2H45M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Trolls World Tour

programme.title: Jugend ohne Gott
Jugend ohne Gott
programme.desc:
Jugend ohne Gott: Directed by Alain Gsponer. With Jannis Niewöhner, Fahri Yardim, Emilia Schüle, Alicia von Rittberg. German students compete to enter one of the country's elite schools." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt5651338/","name":"Jugend ohne Gott","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMDEwOGE5Y2YtMGU3Yi00MGU0LWIyYWItMmU1MTliZjM4N2UwXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMjQ3NzUxOTM@._V1_.jpg","description":"German students compete to enter one of the country's elite schools.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt5651338/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"dadri"},"dateCreated":"2021-04-17","inLanguage":"English","name":"Good cinematography, mediocre dialogues, very interesting end","reviewBody":"This movie depicts a kind-of dystopia where society is separated by individual performance much more than today, but still it somehow doesn't feel so much different than todays reality.

Because it only depicts a few days in total but partly from 3-4 different perspectives, always adding a little background to the story, it has it lengths. It also is a bit pretentious, as another reviewer put it in a nutshell. But I like the reminder - or maybe "warning" - that the story shows us.

The reason, why it doesn't get just 5-6 stars from me but 7-8 stars, are the overall impression (the plot unfolds quite beautifully) as well as the en passant insight about the importance of certain small key actions and key figures and their development. I don't want to spoiler but in the end I really considered two different people as protagonists than throughout most of the film.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":7}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":1572,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":5.8},"genre":["Crime","Drama","Mystery"],"datePublished":"2017-08-31","keywords":"male objectification,bare chested male,reference to god,male nudity,male full frontal nudity","actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1753704/","name":"Jannis Niewöhner"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1689177/","name":"Fahri Yardim"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm2163092/","name":"Emilia Schüle"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1312629/","name":"Alain Gsponer"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0071976/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0002257/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1511407/","name":"Alex Buresch"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1150377/","name":"Matthias Pacht"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0902463/","name":"Ödön von Horvath"}],"duration":"PT1H54M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: The Other Guys
Die etwas anderen Cops
programme.desc: The Other Guys: Directed by Adam McKay. With Will Ferrell, Derek Jeter, Mark Wahlberg, Eva Mendes. Two mismatched New York City detectives seize an opportunity to step up like the city's top cops, whom they idolize, only things don't quite go as planned." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt1386588/","name":"The Other Guys","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMDlhZDQ5NDUtNDcwMi00MTQ5LTk1Y2UtYjNmMjgzNzNhNzU3XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyODE5NzE3OTE@._V1_.jpg","description":"Two mismatched New York City detectives seize an opportunity to step up like the city's top cops, whom they idolize, only things don't quite go as planned.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt1386588/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"ratpackaustin"},"dateCreated":"2019-03-19","inLanguage":"English","name":"one of the most underrated movies ever","reviewBody":"I'm disappointed to see that this film still hasn't garnered the attnention it deserves. Even back when it came out it did so pretty quietly and was thus buried under other big budget flicks. Rarely though does a comedy keep you entertained and laughing throughout pretty much the entire film. Most comedies try and fail, or take breaks from the humor with someone else to preserve material. But Ferrell and Wahlberg play off of eachother perfectly in this film and have real chemistry to keep the film quality high. This is also one of the mostquotable films ever. 9 years later and my dad and I still shoot off a "I'm a peacock captain, you gotta let me fly", or a "if I were a lion and you were a tuna I'd swim out to the middle of the ocean and freakin eat you" every once in a short while. I definitely recommend this movie for fans of comedy","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":8}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":254373,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.7},"contentRating":"PG-13","genre":["Action","Comedy","Crime"],"datePublished":"2010-09-15","keywords":"police,detective,buddy,buddy movie,new york police","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"The Other Guys: International Trailer","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi1253639705","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTM5MTI1MzI2OF5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwMTM0MTk1Mw@@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTM5MTI1MzI2OF5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwMTM0MTk1Mw@@._V1_.jpg","description":"Two mismatched New York City detectives (Ferrell and Wahlberg) seize an opportunity to step up like the city's top cops whom they idolize -- only things don't quite go as planned. Even back when it came out it did so pretty quietly and was thus buried under other big budget flicks. Rarely though does a comedy keep you entertained and laughing throughout pretty much the entire film. Most comedies try and fail, or take breaks from the humor with someone else to preserve material. But Ferrell and Wahlberg play off of eachother perfectly in this film and have real chemistry to keep the film quality high. This is also one of the mostquotable films ever. 9 years later and my dad and I still shoot off a "I'm a peacock captain, you gotta let me fly", or a "if I were a lion and you were a tuna I'd swim out to the middle of the ocean and freakin eat you" every once in a short while. programme.title: Last Man Standing
Last Man Standing
programme.desc:
Last Man Standing: Directed by Walter Hill. With Bruce Willis, Bruce Dern, William Sanderson, Christopher Walken. A drifting gunslinger-for-hire finds himself in the middle of an ongoing war between the Irish and Italian mafia in a Prohibition era ghost town." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0116830/","name":"Last Man Standing","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BOThkYmJjYTMtOWMzNC00ZjQ4LWI4NzAtYjRlMDA3ZWMyYWRmXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNDIyMjczNjI@._V1_.jpg","description":"A drifting gunslinger-for-hire finds himself in the middle of an ongoing war between the Irish and Italian mafia in a Prohibition era ghost town.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0116830/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"PredragReviews"},"dateCreated":"2017-04-04","inLanguage":"English","name":""1911 Heaven"","reviewBody":"This one is a cult classic that while formulaic, still manages to engage and keep the viewer captivated. Filled with old west clichés, yet set in the Prohibition Era, the six shooters have been replaced with 1911's, and the horses with Model Ts. Exaggerated impacts, and body reactions to getting shot, coupled with the never ending supply of ammo that only rarely needs to be topped off, do get annoying. Yet, somehow, the viewer is still sucked into this modern take on Clint Eastwood's classic, A Fistful Of Dollars.

The editing, dialogue, cinematography, music, direction and acting are all top class. Everything is fantastically overblown but never preposterous. As for the film itself, it is very empty but the mood and tone are so very distant and weird, and I totally love it. Walter Hills direction is a well balanced cross between Sam Peckinpah and John Woo. And Cooder's score will transport you right into the movie even on it's own. Of course the film has its faults, there are very few films which posses non. For example Christopher Walken's character, Hickey is built up in his absence throughout the first third of the film as being the ultimate bad guy, however when he does actually appear he is a little tame. In fact he even tells Willis's character, Smith, not to believe all the bad things he has been hearing about him. Perhaps he is the anti-villain to Smith's anti-hero.

All in all, it's a film which is definitely worth seeing, even if you are unfamiliar with either of the two previous versions of the story. 

Overall rating: 7 out of 10.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":7}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":56705,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.4},"contentRating":"R","genre":["Action","Crime","Drama"],"datePublished":"1996-09-20","keywords":"mob violence,neo noir,gang warfare,bar shootout,1930s","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Last Man Standing","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi1435631897","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZjRiMWM4NDctNjkxZS00MzVkLTg2YWItYTk3MTVmMTFiODY0XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZjRiMWM4NDctNjkxZS00MzVkLTg2YWItYTk3MTVmMTFiODY0XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","description":"Trailer for Last Man Standing"},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000246/","name":"Bruce Willis"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001136/","name":"Bruce Dern"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0761836/","name":"William Sanderson"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001353/","name":"Walter Hill"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0046718/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0116594/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0452878/","name":"Ryûzô Kikushima"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000041/","name":"Akira Kurosawa"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001353/","name":"Walter Hill"}],"duration":"PT1H41M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: The Recruit
Der Einsatz
programme.desc:
The Recruit: Directed by Roger Donaldson. With Al Pacino, Colin Farrell, Bridget Moynahan, Gabriel Macht. A brilliant young CIA trainee is asked by his mentor to help find a mole in the Agency." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0292506/","name":"The Recruit","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjE5MDMzOTk3MV5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTYwNTE0NTg2._V1_.jpg","description":"A brilliant young CIA trainee is asked by his mentor to help find a mole in the Agency.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0292506/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"UACW"},"dateCreated":"2006-10-21","inLanguage":"English","name":"Ambiguous?","reviewBody":"Ironic this movie's made by Spyglass? Or is it? Isn't there ambiguity there as well?

Nothing is what it seems.

Yes the writers could have gone over their screenplay and given it another one-two and that may have raised the caliber another notch, but this is still good entertainment. It won't change your life, but it will be a well spent couple of hours.

And it's true the movie could in theory have had a more sophisticated (ambiguous) ending, but there comes a time, after wading through all the trollop on the market, that one just sinks back and decides to enjoy a better movie for all it's worth.

And this is such a movie: directed by the capable Roger Donaldson who directed the taut thriller No Way Out and co-authored by a writer on The Natural, this one keeps going at a brisk pace with excellent editing and super soundtrack from Klaus Badelt of POTC1 fame. Farrell - who actually comes off smaller than life what with all the tripe written about him, and that's not a bad thing - and former fashion model Moynahan make the sparks fly. You feel for the protagonists and that's an essential ingredient of any good movie.

But Pacino: he's great at whatever he does but is he fated to have secondary roles now? Bah.

There's a bit of a 'Spy Game' feel to things but there's no shameless copying going on. There just aren't many movies in this genre. And Spy Game doesn't have the thrill and suspense this one has. Yes, you might eventually figure everything out before the denouement, but you won't be upset. And odds are you won't figure everything out anyway - some yes; all of it - no.

As for that ending: some people would perhaps prefer more ambiguity. On several planes. Others would say the ending is ambiguous enough. At least on one plane, perhaps several.

Nothing is what it seems."},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":132914,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.6},"contentRating":"PG-13","genre":["Action","Thriller"],"datePublished":"2003-04-30","keywords":"recruit,training,watching tv,jefferson memorial,smithsonian institute","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"The Recruit","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi499253529","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNDlhYTM4ZWItOTE3OC00ZjVkLWI0OWMtOTUxZGIxMDljZGU4XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNDlhYTM4ZWItOTE3OC00ZjVkLWI0OWMtOTUxZGIxMDljZGU4XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","description":"CT #2 Post"},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000199/","name":"Al Pacino"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0268199/","name":"Colin Farrell"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0005256/","name":"Bridget Moynahan"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0002044/","name":"Roger Donaldson"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0049348/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0031181/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0166202/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0870013/","name":"Roger Towne"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0934483/","name":"Kurt Wimmer"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0322248/","name":"Mitch Glazer"}],"duration":"PT1H55M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: The Last of the Mohicans
Der letzte Mohikaner
programme.desc:
The Last of the Mohicans: Directed by Michael Mann. With Daniel Day-Lewis, Madeleine Stowe, Russell Means, Eric Schweig. Three trappers protect the daughters of a British Colonel in the midst of the French and Indian War." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0104691/","name":"The Last of the Mohicans","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZDNiYmRkNDYtOWU1NC00NmMxLWFkNmUtMGI5NTJjOTJmYTM5XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzQ1ODk3MTQ@._V1_.jpg","description":"Three trappers protect the daughters of a British Colonel in the midst of the French and Indian War.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0104691/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"ajchappell"},"dateCreated":"2004-11-16","inLanguage":"English","name":"The ultimate early Western romance.","reviewBody":"This film, for reasons that are not completely obvious to me, struck a chord. It was in part the amazing location shots, partly the characters, partly the music and the action sequences. As for the (relatively) under-developed romance between the hero and heroine - all I can say is that the line that Hawkeye delivers when Cora Munro challenges this rough colonial who has the temerity to gaze upon her (a colonel's daughter) and says (essentially): 'Who are you looking at?' Hawkeye answers: 'You, Ma'am. I'm looking at you.' Priceless.

Interestingly, archeologists have recently excavated the site of Fort William Henry and discovered many interesting things, none of which contradict the events described by Fenimore Cooper. The attack on the defeated column in the woods also appears to be historically accurate.

This film, though imperfect, ranks with me as one of the best action movies of all time."},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":160776,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7.7},"contentRating":"R","genre":["Action","Adventure","Drama"],"datePublished":"1992-09-25","keywords":"based on novel,french and indian war,american history,long rifle,woman in jeopardy","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"The Last of the Mohicans","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi999228185","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTFjMDljYzYtMzViZS00N2Q4LTgzNWUtMGQwYjA3ZjgzOGRjXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTFjMDljYzYtMzViZS00N2Q4LTgzNWUtMGQwYjA3ZjgzOGRjXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","description":"Theatrical Trailer from 20th Century Fox"},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000358/","name":"Daniel Day-Lewis"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000656/","name":"Madeleine Stowe"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0575184/","name":"Russell Means"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000520/","name":"Michael Mann"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0033472/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0000756/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0178126/","name":"James Fenimore Cooper"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0049721/","name":"John L. Three trappers protect the daughters of a British Colonel in the midst of the French and Indian War." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0104691/","name":"The Last of the Mohicans","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZDNiYmRkNDYtOWU1NC00NmMxLWFkNmUtMGI5NTJjOTJmYTM5XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzQ1ODk3MTQ@._V1_.jpg","description":"Three trappers protect the daughters of a British Colonel in the midst of the French and Indian War.","review":"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0104691/","author":"@type":"Person","name":"ajchappell","dateCreated":"2004-11-16","inLanguage":"English","name":"The ultimate early Western romance.","reviewBody":"This film, for reasons that are not completely obvious to me, struck a chord. It was in part the amazing location shots, partly the characters, partly the music and the action sequences. As for the (relatively) under-developed romance between the hero and heroine - all I can say is that the line that Hawkeye delivers when Cora Munro challenges this rough colonial who has the temerity to gaze upon her (a colonel's daughter) and says (essentially): 'Who are you looking at?' Hawkeye answers: 'You, Ma'am. I'm looking at you.' Priceless.

Interestingly, archeologists have recently excavated the site of Fort William Henry and discovered many interesting things, none of which contradict the events described by Fenimore Cooper. The attack on the defeated column in the woods also appears to be historically accurate.

This film, though imperfect, ranks with me as one of the best action movies of all time.","aggregateRating":"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":160776,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7.7,"contentRating":"R","genre":["Action","Adventure","Drama"],"datePublished":"1992-09-25","keywords":"based on novel,french and indian war,american history,long rifle,woman in jeopardy","trailer":"@type":"VideoObject","name":"The Last of the Mohicans","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi999228185","thumbnail":"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTFjMDljYzYtMzViZS00N2Q4LTgzNWUtMGQwYjA3ZjgzOGRjXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTFjMDljYzYtMzViZS00N2Q4LTgzNWUtMGQwYjA3ZjgzOGRjXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","description":"Theatrical Trailer from 20th Century Fox","actor":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000358/","name":"Daniel Day-Lewis","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000656/","name":"Madeleine Stowe","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0575184/","name":"Russell Means"],"director":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000520/","name":"Michael Mann"],"creator":["@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0033472/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0000756/","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0178126/","name":"James Fenimore Cooper","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0049721/","name":"John L. programme.title: Free State of Jones
Free State of Jones
programme.desc:
Free State of Jones: Directed by Gary Ross. With Matthew McConaughey, Gugu Mbatha-Raw, Mahershala Ali, Keri Russell. A disillusioned Confederate army deserter returns to Mississippi and leads a militia of fellow deserters and women in an uprising against the corrupt local Confederate government." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt1124037/","name":"Free State of Jones","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTA4NTYyMTcwNTFeQTJeQWpwZ15BbWU4MDI0NTg0MDkx._V1_.jpg","description":"A disillusioned Confederate army deserter returns to Mississippi and leads a militia of fellow deserters and women in an uprising against the corrupt local Confederate government.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt1124037/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"caseynicholson"},"dateCreated":"2016-06-28","inLanguage":"English","name":"A Great Historical Drama","reviewBody":"I'm surprised to see that this movie is currently averaging 6.5/10 stars--I found it to be worthy of an eight, and I even flirted with ranking it even higher.

The movie tells of a counter-rebellion in a Mississippi town during the Civil War, and is based on a true story. The film is done in a style that emulates "Twelve Years A Slave", and as such it deals with topics of slavery and secession in a way that is poignant but also constructive.

In fairness, there are a few things that the film could be rightly critiqued for. The opening scenes of the film are fairly gory and filled with wartime violence, but fortunately that does not dominate the movie. As it progresses, the plot of the film does meander a bit, including a fast forward to a scene from some 85 years after the majority of the film that is interspersed throughout the rest of the movie. That technique felt a bit forced at times, but at the end of the film it made more sense why it had been used. 

Additionally, the movie tells its main tale over the course of more than a decade, which makes for a bit of an odd cinematic journey--but, in my view, none of these issues are so problematic that they greatly take away from the movie. Rather, what we have here is a film that was desperately trying to be Oscar worthy, and that perhaps pushes the creative envelope a tad bit too far.

But again, there is more good here than bad. The story that the movie has to tell is both engaging and important--engaging in that it captures your attention and makes you care about the subject matter in a captivating way, and important in that it draws attention to historical facts that you probably were not aware of. I know it certainly highlighted some elements of Reconstruction that were new to me.

Regarding acting, this was perhaps not McConaughey's best role, but it's also not his worst. The supporting cast turns out a strong performance, and all in all the movie is well made.

That said, I'm going with 8/10 stars on this one. It's not the best Civil War flick ever made, and perhaps pales in comparison with other recent historical dramas like "Twelve Years" and "The Revenant", but it's nevertheless a great movie that deserves a "Very Good" score.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":8}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":55978,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.9},"contentRating":"R","genre":["Action","Biography","Drama"],"datePublished":"2016-06-24","keywords":"civil war,american civil war,election fraud,interracial marriage,based on true story","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Trailer #2","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi2267132953","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTc3NDQyNTg0NV5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwMzI1Mzk5ODE@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTc3NDQyNTg0NV5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwMzI1Mzk5ODE@._V1_.jpg","description":"As civil war divides the nation, a poor farmer from Mississippi leads a group of rebels against the Confederate army."},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000190/","name":"Matthew McConaughey"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1813221/","name":"Gugu Mbatha-Raw"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0991810/","name":"Mahershala Ali"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0002657/","name":"Gary Ross"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0316867/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0506124/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0235528/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0002657/","name":"Gary Ross"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0366989/","name":"Leonard Hartman"}],"duration":"PT2H19M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Cheaper by the Dozen
Im Dutzend billiger
programme.desc: Cheaper by the Dozen: Directed by Shawn Levy. With Steve Martin, Bonnie Hunt, Piper Perabo, Tom Welling. With his wife doing a book tour, a father of twelve must handle a new job and his unstable brood." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0349205/","name":"Cheaper by the Dozen","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTg0NzYxMjY0Ml5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwOTU0NDczMw@@._V1_.jpg","description":"With his wife doing a book tour, a father of twelve must handle a new job and his unstable brood.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0349205/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"PWNYCNY"},"dateCreated":"2010-07-17","inLanguage":"English","name":"Zzzzzzzzzz.","reviewBody":"When watching this movie one is reminded of the word insipid. This movie is appropriate for pre-school age children who have absolutely nothing else to do and would prefer watching images of kids and parents acting silly. Yes, silly is another word that applies to this movie. It is light fare, so light that it floats like a feather, going from one silly scene to another. Oh, another word to describe this movie is cute. Cute is nice but is it entertaining? Is it dramatic? Is it funny? The answer to all three questions is an emphatic no. A movie that cannot be taken seriously is either campy or a comedy and while this movie is not campy it isn't particularly funny either. Other words to describe this movie are schmaltzy, hokey and corny. This movie has the dramatic power of a fair weather cloud. Even Steve Martin cannot rescue this movie from the clutches of banality which can bring even the resolute movie watcher to the brink of boredom and even beyond, to the world of sleep. Zzzzzzzzz.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":5}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":98696,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":5.9},"contentRating":"PG","genre":["Comedy","Family"],"datePublished":"2004-03-17","keywords":"child vomiting,child answering the telephone,flip phone,telephone call,frog in pocket","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Cheaper by the Dozen","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi29229337","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BOTRlNzhmNjktMmVmMi00YTI3LWI2ZDEtNDM0ZDA0MTg0NDczXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BOTRlNzhmNjktMmVmMi00YTI3LWI2ZDEtNDM0ZDA0MTg0NDczXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","description":"Trailer"},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000188/","name":"Steve Martin"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001372/","name":"Bonnie Hunt"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0240381/","name":"Hilary Duff"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0506613/","name":"Shawn Levy"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0000756/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0033486/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0318326/","name":"Frank B. programme.title: Turbo: A Power Rangers Movie
Turbo: Der Power-Rangers-Film
programme.desc: Turbo: A Power Rangers Movie: Directed by Shuki Levy, David Winning. With Jon Simanton, Kai Doi, Greg Collins, Steve Cardenas. A space alien is threatening to bring destruction on Earth, and the Power Rangers are enhanced with turbo powers in order to prevent his plan." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0120389/","name":"Turbo: A Power Rangers Movie","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMzAxMDA0MGUtMWJjYy00YWNlLTk1NmEtNTM5Y2FjYjMzNjM5XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNDAxNjkxNjQ@._V1_.jpg","description":"A space alien is threatening to bring destruction on Earth, and the Power Rangers are enhanced with turbo powers in order to prevent his plan.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0120389/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"jhaggardjr"},"dateCreated":"2000-05-29","inLanguage":"English","name":"Stick with the first one","reviewBody":""Turbo: A Power Rangers Movie" is a film that has to be seen to be disbelieved. The first film, 1995's "Mighty Morphin Power Rangers: The Movie", brought the six butt-kicking teens from the Fox Kids series to the big screen for the first time. That movie was not all that bad. It had some decent special effects, a somewhat interesting bad guy (Ivan Ooze), and the six young actors who play the Power Rangers were fun to watch. Plus, that film had a bigger budget. But they went back to the cheapness of the TV show with "Turbo". The special effects, production design, and costumes are so cheap and cheesy that you wonder why 20th Century Fox gave the go-ahead to let these filmmakers (who are close to the TV show) make this film. Also, the script is much worse than it was in the first movie. Bulk and Skull have more screen time here. It has one of the least interesting villains of all time (actually, a villainess). It's very, very, very, very, very, juvenile. And the Power Ranger actors look as if they want to escape this atrosity. So I have one question. Why did they release this movie to theaters? This should have been released straight to video. Or better yet, release it as a TV movie, were this series started in the first place. This movie was totally inappropriate for the big screen. \n\n* (out of four)","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":2}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":8755,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":3.7},"contentRating":"PG","genre":["Action","Adventure","Family"],"datePublished":"1997-03-28","keywords":"shared universe,supervillain,1990s,power rangers,singing row row row your boat","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Turbo: A Power Rangers Movie","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi65011993","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZjMxODgxOGMtYWI3Ny00ZWJmLWIyMDAtYTE4NzRjN2EyNTA4XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZjMxODgxOGMtYWI3Ny00ZWJmLWIyMDAtYTE4NzRjN2EyNTA4XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","description":"Theatrical Trailer from Unknown"},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0290969/","name":"Jason David Frank"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0840059/","name":"Catherine Sutherland"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0005422/","name":"Hilary Shepard"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0506619/","name":"Shuki Levy"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0003941/","name":"David Winning"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0000756/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0075704/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0053157/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0506619/","name":"Shuki Levy"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0200164/","name":"Shell Danielson"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0536805/","name":"Haim Saban"}],"duration":"PT1H39M"}</script><metacontent="

A space alien is threatening to bring destruction on Earth, and the Power Rangers are enhanced with turbo powers in order to prevent his plan." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0120389/","name":"Turbo: A Power Rangers Movie","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMzAxMDA0MGUtMWJjYy00YWNlLTk1NmEtNTM5Y2FjYjMzNjM5XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNDAxNjkxNjQ@._V1_.jpg","description":"A space alien is threatening to bring destruction on Earth, and the Power Rangers are enhanced with turbo powers in order to prevent his plan.","review":"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0120389/","author":"@type":"Person","name":"jhaggardjr","dateCreated":"2000-05-29","inLanguage":"English","name":"Stick with the first one","reviewBody":""Turbo: A Power Rangers Movie" is a film that has to be seen to be disbelieved. The first film, 1995's "Mighty Morphin Power Rangers: The Movie", brought the six butt-kicking teens from the Fox Kids series to the big screen for the first time. That movie was not all that bad. It had some decent special effects, a somewhat interesting bad guy (Ivan Ooze), and the six young actors who play the Power Rangers were fun to watch. Plus, that film had a bigger budget. But they went back to the cheapness of the TV show with "Turbo". The special effects, production design, and costumes are so cheap and cheesy that you wonder why 20th Century Fox gave the go-ahead to let these filmmakers (who are close to the TV show) make this film. Also, the script is much worse than it was in the first movie. Bulk and Skull have more screen time here. It has one of the least interesting villains of all time (actually, a villainess). It's very, very, very, very, very, juvenile. And the Power Ranger actors look as if they want to escape this atrosity. So I have one question. Why did they release this movie to theaters? This should have been released straight to video. Or better yet, release it as a TV movie, were this series started in the first place. This movie was totally inappropriate for the big screen. \n\n* (out of four)","reviewRating":"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":2,"aggregateRating":"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":8755,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":3.7,"contentRating":"PG","genre":["Action","Adventure","Family"],"datePublished":"1997-03-28","keywords":"shared universe,supervillain,1990s,power rangers,singing row row row your boat","trailer":"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Turbo: A Power Rangers Movie","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi65011993","thumbnail":"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZjMxODgxOGMtYWI3Ny00ZWJmLWIyMDAtYTE4NzRjN2EyNTA4XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZjMxODgxOGMtYWI3Ny00ZWJmLWIyMDAtYTE4NzRjN2EyNTA4XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","description":"Theatrical Trailer from Unknown","actor":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0290969/","name":"Jason David Frank","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0840059/","name":"Catherine Sutherland","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0005422/","name":"Hilary Shepard"],"director":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0506619/","name":"Shuki Levy","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0003941/","name":"David Winning"],"creator":["@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0000756/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0075704/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0053157/","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0506619/","name":"Shuki Levy","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0200164/","name":"Shell Danielson","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0536805/","name":"Haim Saban"],"duration":"PT1H39M"</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Little Women
Little Women
programme.desc:
Little Women: Directed by Greta Gerwig. With Saoirse Ronan, Emma Watson, Florence Pugh, Eliza Scanlen. Jo March reflects back and forth on her life, telling the beloved story of the March sisters - four young women, each determined to live life on her own terms." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt3281548/","name":"Little Women","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BY2QzYTQyYzItMzAwYi00YjZlLThjNTUtNzMyMDdkYzJiNWM4XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMTkxNjUyNQ@@._V1_.jpg","description":"Jo March reflects back and forth on her life, telling the beloved story of the March sisters - four young women, each determined to live life on her own terms.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt3281548/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"scenematica"},"dateCreated":"2020-02-13","inLanguage":"English","name":"Love this little cute dear 4 women","reviewBody":"What we can expect from the girl as a movie director?

Meet Greta, a great director that will make you blame The Academy for not including her as Oscar Best Director nominees. For me, IMHO, she is more entitled to get Oscar Best Director nomination than Todd Philips.

How she direct the entire cast and crew, a camera movement, a music selection, everything is amazing.

A story plot that uses forward and backward flow (a non-linear plot) packed very cleverly. It also shows how smart the use of transition in a film.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":8}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":170649,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7.8},"contentRating":"PG","genre":["Drama","Romance"],"datePublished":"2019-12-25","keywords":"aspiring writer,poverty,mother daughter relationship,based on novel,death of sister","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Official Trailer","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi2655304729","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BY2VjNGY4M2ItNDhmMS00ZTVlLWEyN2EtOWRlNGZkYzMwOTBiXkEyXkFqcGdeQWpnYW1i._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BY2VjNGY4M2ItNDhmMS00ZTVlLWEyN2EtOWRlNGZkYzMwOTBiXkEyXkFqcGdeQWpnYW1i._V1_.jpg","description":"Writer-director Greta Gerwig (Lady Bird) has crafted a Little Women that draws on both the classic novel and the writings of Louisa May Alcott, and unfolds as the author’s alter ego, Jo March, reflects back and forth on her fictional life."},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1519680/","name":"Saoirse Ronan"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0914612/","name":"Emma Watson"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm6073955/","name":"Florence Pugh"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1950086/","name":"Greta Gerwig"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0050868/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0007127/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0532247/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1950086/","name":"Greta Gerwig"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0017301/","name":"Louisa May Alcott"}],"duration":"PT2H15M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Gulliver's Travels
Gullivers Reisen – Da kommt was Grosses auf uns zu
programme.desc:
Gulliver's Travels: Directed by Rob Letterman. With Jack Black, Jason Segel, Emily Blunt, Amanda Peet. Travel writer Lemuel Gulliver takes an assignment in Bermuda but ends up on the island of Lilliput, where he towers over its tiny citizens." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt1320261/","name":"Gulliver's Travels","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTU0NTUwOTM3Nl5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwMDA3NjIwNA@@._V1_.jpg","description":"Travel writer Lemuel Gulliver takes an assignment in Bermuda but ends up on the island of Lilliput, where he towers over its tiny citizens.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt1320261/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"CrashRaindog"},"dateCreated":"2011-08-18","inLanguage":"English","name":"I really wish I could unwatch this film","reviewBody":"As a fan of the original work, which was a satire on the political climate at the time of it's writing, this dire pile of Follywood dross is so far removed from any idea contained within the book it came from that it may as well not be so titled.

Jack Black is beginning to become pretty tiresome in the role he's adopted in most of the films he's appeared in, his appeal is wearing thin. Unless he finds a new direction and follows it, I don't see him being that popular for very much longer, certainly not with people with an IQ greater than their show size at any rate.

I'm appalled that this pathetic attempt at a retelling of a classic tale has been allowed to be passed off as something worth spending money on. In true Hollywood style it is vacuous and totally formulaic to the point that I could predict most of the film. I didn't even bother watching the end as I had better things to do, such as scraping out the oven with my teeth.

I really do wish I could unwatch this terrible film, it didn't even try that hard. The people responsible for this travesty must really think very little of their audience."},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":68102,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":4.9},"contentRating":"PG","genre":["Adventure","Comedy","Family"],"datePublished":"2010-12-29","keywords":"reference to gulliver's travels,reference to gulliver,gulliver,close up of eye,close up of eyes","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Gulliver's Travels - Trailer #1","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi2625476889","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjI1MzQyMjA4MV5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwMzUwMDYwNA@@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjI1MzQyMjA4MV5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwMzUwMDYwNA@@._V1_.jpg","description":"Shipwrecked travel writer Lemuel Gulliver (Black) finds himself transported to an island in the middle of the Bermuda Triangle, where he's a giant among the natives, the Lilliputians. Initially taken prisoner, Gulliver becomes a favorite of the court and schemes for a way in which the Lilliputians can outwith their rivals, the Blefuscudians."},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0085312/","name":"Jack Black"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1289434/","name":"Emily Blunt"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0781981/","name":"Jason Segel"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1224299/","name":"Rob Letterman"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0000756/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0174373/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0022730/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0830294/","name":"Joe Stillman"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0831557/","name":"Nicholas Stoller"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0842605/","name":"Jonathan Swift"}],"duration":"PT1H25M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Peter Pan
Peter Pan
programme.desc:
Peter Pan: Directed by P.J. Hogan. With Jason Isaacs, Jeremy Sumpter, Rachel Hurd-Wood, Lynn Redgrave. The Darling family children receive a visit from Peter Pan, who takes them to Never Never Land where an ongoing war with the evil Pirate Captain Hook is taking place." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0316396/","name":"Peter Pan","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTM0ODI2MzA0NV5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTYwNjUzMzg2._V1_.jpg","description":"The Darling family children receive a visit from Peter Pan, who takes them to Never Never Land where an ongoing war with the evil Pirate Captain Hook is taking place.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0316396/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"acrutherford2004"},"dateCreated":"2004-10-07","inLanguage":"English","name":"A superb rendition of a favourite of adults and children","reviewBody":"This is by far the most accurate and striking adaptation of the J.M. Barrie favourite that has yet been made. Indeed it is difficult to see how it could have been better.

Whilst I'm writing here in praise of the film, I feel I must take issue with the comments of Mr John Ulmer who criticised the film for a number of reasons. I seek to defend the story of Peter Pan and in particular this version. Firstly, it was said that this version has sexual over/undertones.

Erm... well yes... any accurate portrayal of the story would have, as these subtleties are present en masse in the book, indeed more so in the book than in the film it could be argued. It is precisely this evident descent towards Wendy's loss of innocence that both disturbs and excites adult readers of the books and this is quite intentional. Children who are not of an age to appreciate this level are untouched by it but rather take delight in the glorious idea of never having to grow up but instead being allowed to play forever. Indeed the relationship between Pan and Hook is the struggle of youth to overcome the onset of age (singular human vanity and innocent childish rebellion combined). I do not believe that this film's handling of this aspect of the book was merely present in "sick adult humour", I believe that it was beautifully hinted at in a way which would stimulate adult appreciation and childish fascination in the character of Pan.

I should like to make mention of the parallel which Mr Ulmer draws between this version of Peter Pan and Jumanji (namely the use of the same actors to play the adversary and the father of the lead character) is not just a trick put in to hark back to that film. Indeed the tradition of the same actor playing the role of Mr Darling AND Hook dates back to the story's original appearance as a stage play at the turn of the century and has been carried on on most occasions since then, though I concede that the Disney version (a far less worthy and sterilised version) failed to keep this tradition up.

As for the point at which the two boys are hung upside down in their nightshirts, I thought it was funny, as did the rest of the audience in the theatre and we certainly weren't there with a red pen counting the number of bottom shots as Mr Ulmer appears to have done. This film is full of charming humour, adult overtones for the adults, childish fantasy and wonderment for those of the appropriate age. The acting is superb in all areas and I must make particular mention of both Ludivine Sagnier as a wickedly funny Tink and of course Rachel Hurd-Wood whose screen debut showed her as a previously undiscovered talent who will surely go far. All the others were excellent also.

All in all this film rekindled my love of the book which I have now re-read a number of times and makes up for all those years Pan has spent in the Disney wilderness."},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":69987,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.8},"contentRating":"PG","genre":["Adventure","Family","Fantasy"],"datePublished":"2003-12-31","keywords":"peter pan character,captain hook character,smee character,wendy darling character,gagged girl","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Peter Pan","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi2077470745","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNmRiODI5MmEtMGZkOC00NTc4LWIyMGUtOTE5ZmVkMzZjNzU2XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNmRiODI5MmEtMGZkOC00NTc4LWIyMGUtOTE5ZmVkMzZjNzU2XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","description":"Trailer for Peter Pan"},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0838911/","name":"Jeremy Sumpter"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0005042/","name":"Jason Isaacs"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0931404/","name":"Olivia Williams"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0389591/","name":"P.J. Hogan"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0005073/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0050868/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0003580/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0057381/","name":"J.M. Barrie"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0389591/","name":"P.J. Hogan"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0325533/","name":"Michael Goldenberg"}],"duration":"PT1H53M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: The Flintstones
Flintstones – Die Familie Feuerstein
programme.desc:
The Flintstones: Directed by Brian Levant. With John Goodman, Elizabeth Perkins, Rick Moranis, Rosie O'Donnell. In a parallel modern-day Stone Age world, a working-class family, the Flintstones, are set up for an executive job. But they learn that money can't buy happiness." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0109813/","name":"The Flintstones","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYzY0ZTk4YzctNzYzNy00ZDQ0LTg2Y2ItZTQyYzQxMjQwMDc2XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNTAyODkwOQ@@._V1_.jpg","description":"In a parallel modern-day Stone Age world, a working-class family, the Flintstones, are set up for an executive job. But they learn that money can't buy happiness.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0109813/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"lukem-52760"},"dateCreated":"2019-06-30","inLanguage":"English","name":"GREAT PURE 90'S MAGICAL INNOCENT FUN.","reviewBody":"I grew up in the 90's & it was a great time & so much better than today 2019,it seemed such a fun,innocent & happier time & a great time for feelgood family films such as Casper (1995),SpaceJam (1997),Jumanji (1995),Flubber (1998),Small Soldiers (1998),ConeHeads (1993) & many many more that came out during that Awesome time. The Flintstones was a huge summertime blockbuster that's full of fun & Happy times mixed into a colourful live-action version of the classic cartoon.

I loved this movie when it came (i still do) & i remember so much merchandise & promotion for this,it was everywhere. I had action figures & fridge magnets & cups & all sorts from the movie!!! The Flintstones was huge in 1994!!! Legendary Steven Spielberg was producer so you knew the effort & budget that went into this project was huge along with the nice Spielberg feel of family & sense of wonder.

John Goodman was PERFECT as Fred Flintstone,he gave a fully fun & often touching performance & is a joy to watch. He really brought the character to life but kept the silly funny feel of fred. Legendary comic great Rick Moranis was also perfect as freds best buddy Barney Rubble & also plays his role with fun & Heart. The whole cast is great & seemed to all be having so much fun!!! Rosie O'Donnell was good fun as Betty Rubble & Elizabeth Perkins is great as Wilma Flintstone.

The music is lovely & full of Nostalgia, the production design & sets are absolutely beautiful,they created such a stunningly beautiful world for the Flintstones & it's gorgeous!!!

The Flintstones is harmless,Happy & feelgood fun for the whole family & is a great film from my childhood growing up so i hold a special little spot in my heart for this lovely little comedy.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":8}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":79032,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":4.9},"contentRating":"PG","genre":["Comedy","Family","Fantasy"],"datePublished":"1994-05-27","keywords":"based on tv series,stone age,reboot of series,based on cartoon,dinosaur","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"The Flintstones (1994)","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi1458700569","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZjQ2YWIxZDktMjkxMC00YmFkLWFkYzQtNjZiMmI5ZTgwYzUzXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZjQ2YWIxZDktMjkxMC00YmFkLWFkYzQtNjZiMmI5ZTgwYzUzXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","description":"Theatrical Trailer from Amblin"},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000422/","name":"John Goodman"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001548/","name":"Rick Moranis"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0005280/","name":"Rosie O'Donnell"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0505152/","name":"Brian Levant"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0005073/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0009119/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0024579/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0662678/","name":"Tom S. Parker"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0421084/","name":"Jim Jennewein"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0211823/","name":"Steven E. de Souza"}],"duration":"PT1H31M"}</script><metacontent="

But they learn that money can't buy happiness." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0109813/","name":"The Flintstones","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYzY0ZTk4YzctNzYzNy00ZDQ0LTg2Y2ItZTQyYzQxMjQwMDc2XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNTAyODkwOQ@@._V1_.jpg","description":"In a parallel modern-day Stone Age world, a working-class family, the Flintstones, are set up for an executive job. But they learn that money can't buy happiness.","review":"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0109813/","author":"@type":"Person","name":"lukem-52760","dateCreated":"2019-06-30","inLanguage":"English","name":"GREAT PURE 90'S MAGICAL INNOCENT FUN.","reviewBody":"I grew up in the 90's & it was a great time & so much better than today 2019,it seemed such a fun,innocent & happier time & a great time for feelgood family films such as Casper (1995),SpaceJam (1997),Jumanji (1995),Flubber (1998),Small Soldiers (1998),ConeHeads (1993) & many many more that came out during that Awesome time. The Flintstones was a huge summertime blockbuster that's full of fun & Happy times mixed into a colourful live-action version of the classic cartoon.

I loved this movie when it came (i still do) & i remember so much merchandise & promotion for this,it was everywhere. I had action figures & fridge magnets & cups & all sorts from the movie!!! The Flintstones was huge in 1994!!! Legendary Steven Spielberg was producer so you knew the effort & budget that went into this project was huge along with the nice Spielberg feel of family & sense of wonder.

John Goodman was PERFECT as Fred Flintstone,he gave a fully fun & often touching performance & is a joy to watch. He really brought the character to life but kept the silly funny feel of fred. Legendary comic great Rick Moranis was also perfect as freds best buddy Barney Rubble & also plays his role with fun & Heart. The whole cast is great & seemed to all be having so much fun!!! Rosie O'Donnell was good fun as Betty Rubble & Elizabeth Perkins is great as Wilma Flintstone.

The music is lovely & full of Nostalgia, the production design & sets are absolutely beautiful,they created such a stunningly beautiful world for the Flintstones & it's gorgeous!!!

The Flintstones is harmless,Happy & feelgood fun for the whole family & is a great film from my childhood growing up so i hold a special little spot in my heart for this lovely little comedy.","reviewRating":"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":8,"aggregateRating":"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":79032,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":4.9,"contentRating":"PG","genre":["Comedy","Family","Fantasy"],"datePublished":"1994-05-27","keywords":"based on tv series,stone age,reboot of series,based on cartoon,dinosaur","trailer":"@type":"VideoObject","name":"The Flintstones (1994)","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi1458700569","thumbnail":"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZjQ2YWIxZDktMjkxMC00YmFkLWFkYzQtNjZiMmI5ZTgwYzUzXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZjQ2YWIxZDktMjkxMC00YmFkLWFkYzQtNjZiMmI5ZTgwYzUzXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","description":"Theatrical Trailer from Amblin","actor":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000422/","name":"John Goodman","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001548/","name":"Rick Moranis","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0005280/","name":"Rosie O'Donnell"],"director":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0505152/","name":"Brian Levant"],"creator":["@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0005073/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0009119/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0024579/","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0662678/","name":"Tom S. programme.title: The Flintstones in Viva Rock Vegas
Die Flintstones in Viva Rock Vegas
programme.desc:
The Flintstones in Viva Rock Vegas: Directed by Brian Levant. With Mark Addy, Stephen Baldwin, Kristen Johnston, Jane Krakowski. In this live-action prequel to The Flintstones (1994), the Flintstones and the Rubbles go on a trip to Rock Vegas, where Wilma Slaghoople is pursued by playboy Chip Rockefeller." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0158622/","name":"The Flintstones in Viva Rock Vegas","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNTUzYzQzMGQtNTYyNS00NmUzLThmZmUtMmIyNjQzNDU4YWYwXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNTUyMzE4Mzg@._V1_.jpg","description":"In this live-action prequel to The Flintstones (1994), the Flintstones and the Rubbles go on a trip to Rock Vegas, where Wilma Slaghoople is pursued by playboy Chip Rockefeller.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0158622/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"jjs402"},"dateCreated":"2000-09-30","inLanguage":"English","name":"Lighten up, Francis. It's a cartoon sequel.","reviewBody":"Way too many critical comments. This is a cute family movie with just enough humor and tensions and moral to suit all viewers regardless of age. The special effects are good and the cinematography is actually interesting.

Some of the double entrendres are cute, but they harmlessly go right over the kid's head. (Remember, the theme song says "...They'll have a gay old time.")

There's a couple of clever buried jokes. (Did anyone else catch Gazoo's "Klaatu berada niktor" comment?)

Also, Kristin Johnson is quite easy on the eyes.

Remember, it's a MOVIE based on a CARTOON. Set your expectations accordingly. Enjoy.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":8}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":22982,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":3.7},"contentRating":"PG","genre":["Comedy","Family","Romance"],"datePublished":"2001-04-11","keywords":"the flintstones,love,prequel,based on tv series,title appears in song","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"The Flintstones in Viva Rock Vegas","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi3118858521","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNzlhZDU2NGEtZWM5Ni00NmE2LWEwMWItYmQ1ZDRjMjdhZTc3XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNzlhZDU2NGEtZWM5Ni00NmE2LWEwMWItYmQ1ZDRjMjdhZTc3XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","description":"Home Video Trailer from Universal Studios Home Entertainment"},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0004692/","name":"Mark Addy"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000286/","name":"Stephen Baldwin"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0005060/","name":"Kristen Johnston"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0505152/","name":"Brian Levant"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0005073/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0009119/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0024579/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0360253/","name":"William Hanna"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0053484/","name":"Joseph Barbera"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0438226/","name":"Deborah Kaplan"}],"duration":"PT1H30M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Hui Buh: Das Schlossgespenst
Hui Buh – Das Schlossgespenst
programme.desc:
Hui Buh: Das Schlossgespenst: Directed by Sebastian Niemann. With Michael Herbig, Christoph Maria Herbst, Heike Makatsch, Ellenie Salvo González. Five hundred years ago, Hui Buh cheated in a card game, thus was turned into a ghost by thunder lighting. For all this time, he has lived in the castle alone without anyone to scare. Until when King Julius moves in for his wedding, Hui Buh knows he has to use every trick of his to keep the long-wasted ghost license." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0428646/","name":"Hui Buh: Das Schlossgespenst","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZDY3MGI2NDUtYmM4Mi00MzQ2LThjYWYtODAxYTI2MzcwOWVhL2ltYWdlL2ltYWdlXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMzA3Njg4MzY@._V1_.jpg","description":"Five hundred years ago, Hui Buh cheated in a card game, thus was turned into a ghost by thunder lighting. For all this time, he has lived in the castle alone without anyone to scare. Until when King Julius moves in for his wedding, H","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0428646/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"Equinox23"},"dateCreated":"2012-04-20","inLanguage":"English","name":"A surprisingly wonderful movie","reviewBody":"I must admit that my young daughter forced me to watch this movie and my expectations were pretty low, thus slightly bored and awkward I joined her after she had already watched about half of it...And what a surprise, I instantaneously fell in love with it.The sets are wonderfully old-fashioned and German, the thing German viewers would probably get annoyed at is that a lot of German clichés are made fun of, e.g. ghost soldiers wearing spiked helmets, a castle that is reminiscent of Neuschwanstein Castle - I felt like being way back in Texas in 1987 and being asked if Germany still was a kingdom - and if they had watched this movie beforehand, they would have definitely believed so -, especially because it is hard to tell which specific time this movie is actually set in. In a way I can imagine that this feature would be more appreciated in the countries outside Germany, I do not exactly know why but most Germans do have an exceedingly hard time laughing about themselves. 

Though the movie's namesake the ghost Hui Buh may be a little bit over the top according to my taste, the acting is superb, especially Christoph Maria Herbst as König Julius,der 111.; his timing is absolutely brilliant (and this is probably the closest he will ever get to playing a romantic lead). The humour in this comedy is at times hilarious and silly,but never ever turns nasty.

BTW I immediately ventured to watch the entire movie... ;)","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":10}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":2826,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":4.7},"genre":["Animation","Adventure","Comedy"],"datePublished":"2006-07-20","keywords":"surprise during end credits,ghost,castle,based on novel","actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0378660/","name":"Michael Herbig"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0378698/","name":"Christoph Maria Herbst"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0538443/","name":"Heike Makatsch"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0631093/","name":"Sebastian Niemann"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0065798/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0126435/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0002257/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0004308/","name":"Dirk Ahner"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1743403/","name":"Eberhard Alexander Burgh"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0631093/","name":"Sebastian Niemann"}],"duration":"PT1H43M"}</script><metacontent="
